edu.iastate.ansci.flip.database

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.iastate.ansci.flip.database.Message

  • public class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    Message class: This class provides methods to create a multi-purpose message that can be submitted to a selected user destination or a group of users.
    Author:
    patricio

      • setContentMessage

        public void setContentMessage(java.lang.String data)
        Set content of a message. A message content can have several messages, each one is separated from each other with a DELIM character.
        Use only when a message is retrieved from database, an the Message object needs to be re-built.
        Otherwise use setMessage(String string)
        Parameters:
        data -

      • setSender

        public void setSender(java.lang.String snd)
        Set a message's sender
        Parameters:
        snd - : Sender's username

      • getSender

        public java.lang.String getSender()
        Returns:
        username of the message's sender

      • setDestination

        public void setDestination(java.lang.String snd)
        Set the username of the message's destination
        Parameters:
        snd - : Destination's username

      • getDestination

        public java.lang.String getDestination()
        Returns:
        Username of the message's destination

      • getStringContentMessage

        public java.lang.String getStringContentMessage()
        Get the all content of the message object. Several message contents are separated by the DELIM character. Use only to re-build a Message object.
        Otherwise call getMessage(int index) and numMessages()
        Returns:
        a string value

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Convert message object into a string
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getPersistency

        public boolean getPersistency()
        Get Persistency parameter
        Returns:
        true if message can only be deleted by the the destination. False otherwise

      • setPersistency

        public void setPersistency(boolean b)
        Set persistency of a message
        Parameters:
        b - : true, message can only be deleted by the the destination. Otherwise set is as false
